contentrichtext.text: {{Other uses|Ob (disambiguation)}} {{one source|date=April 2013}} {{Coord|68|50|N|73|30|E|display=title}} [[File:Gulf of Ob map.png|thumb|250px|left|A map showing the location of the Kara Sea and Ob Bay]] [[File:GydaTajmyrJamal.JPG|thumb|250px|right|Satellite image of the Gulf of Ob]] The '''Gulf of Ob''' (also known as ''Ob Bay'') ({{lang-ru|О́бская губа́}}, ''Obskaya guba'') is a [[headlands and bays|bay]] of the [[Arctic Ocean]], located in Northern [[Russia]] at the mouth of the [[Ob River]].<ref name="earth">[http://www.eosnap.com/tag/gulf-of-ob/ "Gulf of Ob."] [http://www.eosnap.com Earthsnapshot.com]. Accessed June 2011.</ref> This Gulf flows into the [[Kara Sea]] between the [[Gydan Peninsula|Gydan]] and [[Yamal Peninsula|Yamal]] peninsulas.<ref name="earth"/> It is about 1,000 km (600 mi) long and varies in width from about 50 km (30 mi) to 80 km (50 mi), and generally runs north and south.<ref name="earth"/> It is relatively shallow, with an average depth from ten to twelve metres which restricts heavy sea transport. The [[Taz Estuary]] is an eastern side-branch formed by the [[Taz River]]. There are several islands near the mouth of the Ob, at the beginning of the estuary, like '''Khaley'''. All these islands are close to the shore and they are generally flat and low-lying. They are protected wetlands under [[Ramsar sites in Russia|Ramsar]]. Further north, except for a few islands located close to the shore, like '''Khalevigo''' and '''Nyavigo''', the Gulf of Ob is free of islands until it meets the [[Kara Sea]]. Very large [[natural gas|gas]] and [[petroleum|oil]] deposits have been discovered in this region. Oil and gas from the wells are sent South via [[Pipeline transport|pipeline]] and [[rail transport]]. The [[Yamburg gas field]] is the world's [[World Largest Gas Fields|third largest]] [[natural gas field]], and is located between the southern portion of the gulf and the Taz Estuary to the east. {{-}} ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.ipdn.ru/rics/doc0/MB/Gl3-5.htm Islands at the mouth of the Ob] *[http://wetlands.oopt.info/obguba/index.html Protected wetlands] *[http://www.akerarctic.fi/publications/pdf/Poac01XTransportationsystem.pdf A very thorough paper about this region] {{DEFAULTSORT:Ob, Gulf of}} {{YamaloNenetsAutonomousOkrug-geo-stub}} [[Category:Bays of the Kara Sea]] [[Category:Geography of Yamalo-Nenets Autonomous Okrug]] [[Category:Ob basin]]
